Gobstoppers	B-MISC

about	O
1	B-NUM
–	I-NUM
3	I-NUM
 	I-NUM
cm	I-NUM
across	O
;	O
though	O
gobstoppers	O
can	O
be	O
up	O
to	O
8	B-NUM
 	I-NUM
cm	I-NUM
in	O

.	O

from	O
'	O

'	O

is	O

in	O

for	O
mouth	O
.	O

.	O

are	O
too	O
hard	O

Wichqana	B-LOC

Culture	O
:	O
Wichqana	B-LOC
was	O
active	O
from	O
around	O
1200	B-TIME
-	O

BC	I-TIME

was	O

The	O
four	B-MISC
-	I-MISC

fourspot	B-MISC

Today	I-MISC
was	O

as	O

Wehrkraftzersetzung	B-MISC
is	O
a	O
term	O
from	O
German	B-LOC
military	O
law	O
during	O
the	O
Third	B-LOC
Reich	I-LOC
.	O

In	O
1938	B-TIME
,	O
with	O
Adolf	B-PER
Hitler	I-PER
moving	O
Germany	B-LOC
closer	O
to	O
war	O
,	O
the	O
Nazi	B-ORG
government	O
issued	O
a	O
decree	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
suppressing	O
any	O
activity	O
opposed	O
to	O
the	O
Nazi	B-ORG
regime	O
or	O
the	O
Wehrmacht	B-ORG
.	O

The	O
anti	O
-	O
sedition	O
decree	O
included	O
the	O
crime	O
of	O
Zersetzung	B-MISC
der	I-MISC
Wehrkraft	I-MISC
.	O

Commonly	O
called	O
Wehrkraftzersetzung	B-MISC
,	O
the	O
term	O
is	O
variously	O
translated	O
as	O
"	O
subversion	O
of	O
the	O
war	O
effort	O
"	O
,	O
"	O
undermining	O
military	O
morale	O
"	O
and	O
"	O
sedition	O
and	O
defeatism	O
"	O
.	O

Paragraphs	O
already	O
in	O
the	O
military	O
penal	O
code	O
were	O
consolidated	O
and	O
redefined	O
,	O
creating	O
the	O
new	O
crime	O
,	O
which	O
carried	O
the	O
death	O
penalty	O
.	O

In	O
1939	B-TIME
,	O
a	O
second	O
decree	O
was	O
issued	O
that	O
extended	O
the	O
crime	O
to	O
civilians	O
.	O

Discouraging	O

about	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
Third	B-LOC

.	O

Deanolis	B-MISC

,	O

(	O

20	B-NUM
 	I-NUM
mm	I-NUM
.	O

The	O
Labor	B-MISC

of	I-MISC
the	I-MISC

.	O

Labor	B-MISC
day	I-MISC
,	O

1	I-TIME
,	I-TIME

by	O
Late	O

of	O

Ferdinand	B-PER

of	O

.	O

The	O
Labor	B-MISC
Code	I-MISC
sets	O
the	O
rules	O
for	O
hiring	O
and	O

of	O

;	O

;	O
and	O

guidelines	O
in	O
the	O
organization	O
and	O

in	O
labor	O

in	O

.	O

The	O
Labor	B-MISC
Code	I-MISC
contains	O
several	O
provisions	O
which	O
are	O
beneficial	O
to	O
labor	O
.	O

It	O
prohibits	O
termination	O
of	O
employment	O
of	O

employees	O
except	O
for	O
just	O
or	O

as	O

in	O
Article	O
282	B-NUM
to	O
284	B-NUM
of	O

Code	B-MISC
.	O

The	O
right	O
to	O
self	O
-	O
organization	O
of	O
a	O
union	O
is	O
expressly	O
recognized	O
,	O
as	O
is	O
the	O
right	O
of	O

to	O

on	O
a	O

.	O

Strikes	O
are	O
also	O
authorized	O
for	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
they	O
comply	O
with	O
the	O
strict	O

the	O
Code	B-MISC
,	O
and	O

who	O

or	O

in	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
list	O
of	O
Supreme	B-ORG
Court	I-ORG
of	O
the	B-LOC
United	I-LOC
States	I-LOC
cases	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
copyright	O
law	O
.	O

In	O
the	B-MISC
United	I-MISC
States	I-MISC
Constitution	I-MISC
,	O
the	O
Copyright	B-MISC
Clause	I-MISC
in	O
Article	O
1	O
,	O
Section	O
8	O
endows	O
Congress	B-ORG
with	O
the	O
power	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
copyright	O
system	O
.	O

To	O
avoid	O
individual	O
states	O
'	O
attempts	O
at	O
creating	O
their	O
own	O
copyright	O
systems	O
,	O
Congress	B-ORG
passed	O
the	O
Copyright	B-MISC
Act	I-MISC
of	I-MISC
1790	I-MISC
,	O
based	O
on	O
Great	B-LOC
Britain	I-LOC
's	O
Statute	B-MISC
of	I-MISC
Anne	I-MISC
.	O

Over	O
the	O
decades	O
since	O
,	O
copyright	O
in	O
the	B-LOC
United	I-LOC
States	I-LOC
has	O
become	O
a	O
more	O
complicated	O
system	O
with	O
longer	O
terms	O
and	O
more	O
tests	O
,	O
and	O
has	O
been	O
the	O
subject	O
of	O
many	O

by	O
the	O
Court	B-ORG
.	O

The	O
Supreme	B-ORG
Court	I-ORG
was	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
concepts	O
in	O
the	O
field	O
,	O
including	O
fair	O
use	O
,	O
the	O
idea	O
-	O
expression	O
divide	O
,	O
the	O
useful	O
articles	O
or	O
separability	O
doctrine	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
uncopyrightability	O
of	O
federal	O
documents	O
.	O

This	O
list	O
is	O
a	O
list	O
solely	O
of	O
United	B-ORG
States	I-ORG
Supreme	I-ORG
Court	I-ORG
decisions	O
about	O

copyright	O
law	O
.	O

Not	O

decisions	O
are	O
ultimately	O
influential	O
and	O
,	O
as	O
in	O
other	O

,	O

the	O
Supreme	B-ORG

level	O
.	O

Many	O

come	O
to	O
be	O

this	O

.	O

Because	O

a	O

of	O

Constitution	B-MISC
and	O
much	O
the	O
same	O

the	O
opinions	O
.	O

the	O
country	O
.	O

Regional	O
effects	O
of	O
global	O
warming	O
are	O
long	O
-	O
term	O
significant	O
changes	O
in	O
the	O
expected	O
patterns	O
of	O
average	O
weather	O
of	O
a	O
specific	O
region	O
due	O
to	O
global	O
warming	O
.	O

The	O
world	O
average	O
temperature	O
is	O
rising	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
greenhouse	O
effect	O
caused	O
by	O
increasing	O
levels	O
of	O
greenhouse	O
gases	O
,	O
especially	O
carbon	O
dioxide	O
.	O

When	O
the	O
global	O
temperature	O
changes	O
,	O
the	O
changes	O
in	O
climate	O
are	O
not	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
uniform	O
across	O
the	O
Earth	B-LOC
.	O

In	O
particular	O
,	O
land	O
areas	O
change	O
more	O
quickly	O
than	O
oceans	O
,	O
and	O
northern	O
high	O
latitudes	O
change	O
more	O
quickly	O
than	O
the	O
tropics	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
margins	O
of	O
biome	O
regions	O
change	O
faster	O
than	O
do	O
their	O
cores	O
.	O

Regional	O
effects	O
of	O
global	O
warming	O
vary	O
in	O
nature	O
.	O

Some	O
are	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
generalised	O
global	O
change	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
rising	O
temperature	O
,	O
resulting	O
in	O
local	O
effects	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
melting	O
ice	O
.	O

In	O
other	O
cases	O
,	O
a	O
change	O
may	O
be	O
related	O
to	O
a	O
change	O
in	O
a	O
particular	O
ocean	O
current	O
or	O
weather	O
system	O
.	O

In	O
such	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
regional	O
effect	O
may	O
be	O
disproportionate	O
and	O
will	O
not	O
necessarily	O
follow	O
the	O
global	O
trend	O
.	O

The	O
increasing	O
temperatures	O
from	O
greenhouse	O
gases	O
have	O
been	O
causing	O
sea	O
levels	O
to	O
rise	O
for	O
many	O
years	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
three	B-NUM
major	O
ways	O
in	O
which	O
global	O
warming	O
will	O
make	O
changes	O
to	O
regional	O
climate	O
:	O
melting	O
or	O
forming	O
ice	O
,	O
changing	O
the	O
hydrological	O
cycle	O
(	O
of	O
evaporation	O
and	O
precipitation	O
)	O
and	O
changing	O
currents	O
in	O
the	O
oceans	O
and	O
air	O
flows	O
in	O
the	O
atmosphere	O
.	O

The	O
coast	O
can	O
also	O
be	O
considered	O
a	O
region	O
,	O
and	O
will	O
suffer	O
severe	O
impacts	O
from	O
sea	O
level	O
rise	O
.	O

The	O
Arctic	B-LOC
,	O
Africa	B-LOC
,	O
small	O
islands	O
and	O
Asian	B-LOC
megadeltas	O
are	O
regions	O
that	O
are	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
especially	O
affected	O
by	O
future	O
climate	O
change	O
.	O

Africa	B-LOC
is	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
most	O
vulnerable	O
continents	O
to	O
climate	O
variability	O
and	O
change	O
because	O
of	O
multiple	O
existing	O
stresses	O
and	O
low	O

capacity	O
.	O

Climate	O
change	O
is	O
projected	O
to	O
decrease	O
freshwater	O
availability	O
in	O
central	O
,	O
south	O
,	O
east	O
and	O
southeast	O

,	O
particularly	O
in	O
large	O

.	O

and	O
increasing	O
demand	O
from	O
higher	O
standards	O
of	O
living	O
,	O

could	O
adversely	O
affect	O
more	O
than	O
a	B-NUM
billion	I-NUM
people	O
by	O
the	O
2050s	B-TIME
.	O

Small	O
islands	O
,	O
whether	O
located	O
in	O
the	O
tropics	O

higher	O
latitudes	O
,	O
are	O
already	O

weather	O

and	O

in	O
sea	O
level	O
.	O

likely	O
make	O
these	O
areas	O
sensitive	O
to	O
the	O
effects	O
of	O
climate	O
change	O
.	O

A	O
geologic	O
era	O
is	O
a	O
subdivision	O
of	O
geologic	O
time	O
that	O
divides	O
an	O
eon	O
into	O
smaller	O
units	O
of	O
time	O
.	O

The	O
Phanerozoic	B-TIME
Eon	I-TIME
is	O
divided	O
into	O
three	B-NUM
such	O
time	O
frames	O
:	O
the	O
Paleozoic	B-TIME
,	O
Mesozoic	B-TIME
,	O
and	O
Cenozoic	B-TIME
(	O
meaning	O
"	O
old	O
life	O
"	O
,	O
"	O
middle	O
life	O
"	O
and	O
"	O
recent	O
life	O
"	O
)	O
that	O
represent	O
the	O
major	O
stages	O
in	O
the	O
macroscopic	O
fossil	O
record	O
.	O

These	O
eras	O
are	O
separated	O
by	O
catastrophic	O
extinction	O
boundaries	O
,	O
the	O
P	B-MISC
-	I-MISC
T	I-MISC
boundary	I-MISC
between	O
the	O
Paleozoic	B-TIME
and	O
the	O
Mesozoic	B-TIME
and	O
the	O
K	B-MISC
-	I-MISC
Pg	I-MISC
boundary	I-MISC
between	O
the	O
Mesozoic	B-TIME
and	O
the	O
Cenozoic	B-TIME
.	O

There	O
is	O
evidence	O
that	O
catastrophic	O
meteorite	O
impacts	O
played	O
a	O
role	O
in	O
demarcating	O
the	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
eras	O
.	O

The	O
Hadean	B-TIME
,	O
Archean	B-TIME
and	O
Proterozoic	B-TIME
eons	O
were	O
as	O
a	O
whole	O
formerly	O
called	O
the	O
Precambrian	B-TIME
.	O

This	O
covered	O
the	O
four	B-NUM
billion	I-NUM
years	O
of	O
Earth	B-LOC
history	O
prior	O
to	O
the	O
appearance	O
of	O
hard	O
-	O
shelled	O
animals	O
.	O

More	O
recently	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
the	O
Archean	B-TIME
and	O
Proterozoic	B-TIME
eons	O
have	O
been	O
subdivided	O
into	O
eras	O
of	O
their	O
own	O
.	O

Geologic	O
eras	O
are	O
further	O
subdivided	O
into	O
geologic	O
periods	O
,	O
although	O
the	O
Archean	B-TIME
eras	O
have	O
yet	O
to	O
be	O
subdivided	O
in	O
this	O
way	O
.	O

OpenVMS	B-MISC
is	O
a	O
closed	O
-	O
source	O
,	O
proprietary	O
computer	O

system	O
for	O
use	O
in	O
general	O
-	O
purpose	O
computing	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
the	O
successor	O
to	O
the	O
VMS	B-MISC
Operating	I-MISC
System	I-MISC
(	O
VAX-11/VMS	B-MISC
,	O
VAX	B-MISC
/	I-MISC
VMS	I-MISC
)	O
,	O
that	O
was	O
produced	O
by	O
Digital	B-ORG
Equipment	I-ORG
Corporation	I-ORG
,	O
and	O
first	O
released	O
in	O
1977	B-TIME
for	O
its	O

.	O

The	O
11/780	O
was	O

at	O
DEC	B-ORG
's	O
Oct.	B-TIME
25	I-TIME
,	I-TIME

.	O

In	O

,	O

was	O
used	O
for	O
the	O
successor	O
series	O
of	O
DEC	B-MISC
Alpha	I-MISC
systems	O
.	O

OpenVMS	B-MISC
also	O
runs	O
on	O
the	O
HP	B-MISC
Itanium	I-MISC
-	O
based	O
families	O
of	O

,	O
a	O

to	O

x86	B-MISC
-	I-MISC

.	O

The	O

VMS	B-MISC
is	O

from	O

memory	O
system	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
one	O
of	O
its	O

.	O

OpenVMS	B-MISC
is	O
a	O
proprietary	O
operating	O
system	O
,	O
but	O
source	O
code	O
listings	O
are	O
available	O
for	O

.	O

OpenVMS	B-MISC
is	O
a	O
multi	O
-	O
user	O
,	O
multiprocessing	O
virtual	O
memory	O
-	O
based	O
operating	O
system	O
(	O
OS	B-MISC
)	O
designed	O
for	O
use	O
in	O
time	O
-	O
sharing	O
,	O
batch	O
processing	O
,	O
and	O
transaction	O
processing	O
.	O

When	O
process	O
priorities	O
are	O
suitably	O
adjusted	O
,	O
it	O
may	O
approach	O
real	O
-	O
time	O
operating	O
system	O
characteristics	O
.	O

The	O
system	O
offers	O
high	O
availability	O
through	O
clustering	O
and	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
distribute	O
the	O
system	O
over	O
multiple	O
physical	O
machines	O
.	O

This	O
allows	O
the	O
system	O
to	O
be	O
tolerant	O
against	O
disasters	O
that	O
may	O
disable	O
individual	O
data	O
-	O
processing	O
facilities	O
.	O

OpenVMS	B-MISC
contains	O
a	O
graphical	O
user	O
interface	O
(	O
GUI	B-MISC
)	O
,	O
a	O
feature	O
that	O
was	O

on	O

VAX-11/VMS	B-MISC
system	O
.	O

systems	O

,	O

system	O

from	O

,	O
such	O
as	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

of	O
VMS	B-MISC
running	O
on	O

workstations	O
in	O

and	O

Graphics	I-MISC

(	O

)	O

.	O

Enterprise	O
-	O
class	O

and	O

,	O

and	O

environments	O
where	O
system	O
uptime	O
and	O

is	O
critical	O
.	O

System	O
up	O
-	O
times	O
of	O
more	O
than	O
10	B-TIME
years	I-TIME
have	O
been	O
reported	O
,	O
and	O
features	O
such	O
as	O

upgrades	O
and	O

allow	O

applications	O
and	O

to	O
remain	O
continuously	O
accessible	O
while	O

system	O

and	O

The	O

The	O

China	B-LOC
as	O
early	O
as	O

the	O

among	O

of	O

Eaton	B-MISC
's	I-MISC
Corrasable	I-MISC
Bond	I-MISC
is	O
a	O
trademarked	O
name	O
for	O
a	O
brand	O
of	O
erasable	O
typing	O
paper	O
.	O

Erasable	O
paper	O
has	O
a	O
glazed	O
or	O
coated	O
surface	O
which	O
is	O
almost	O
invisible	O
,	O
is	O
easily	O
removed	O
by	O
friction	O
,	O
and	O
accepts	O
typewriter	O
ink	O
fairly	O
well	O
.	O

Removing	O
the	O
coating	O
removes	O
the	O
ink	O
on	O
top	O
of	O
it	O
,	O
so	O
mistakes	O
can	O
be	O
easily	O
erased	O
once	O
.	O

After	O
erasure	O
,	O
the	O
correction	O
is	O
typed	O
onto	O
an	O
unprotected	O
paper	O
surface	O
and	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
easily	O
erased	O
a	O
second	O
time	O
.	O

Because	O
the	O
coated	O
surface	O
does	O
not	O
absorb	O
ink	O
,	O
erasable	O
paper	O
is	O
apt	O
to	O
smudge	O
.	O

Since	O
the	O
coating	O
is	O
intended	O
to	O
be	O
easily	O
removed	O
by	O
friction	O
,	O
the	O
typed	O
pages	O
are	O
not	O
very	O
durable	O
.	O

Under	O
some	O
storage	O
conditions	O
,	O
the	O
coating	O
is	O
apt	O
to	O
make	O
pages	O
stick	O
together	O
.	O

Erasable	O
paper	O
is	O
not	O
suitable	O
for	O
legal	O
documents	O
or	O
archival	O
records	O
.	O

It	O
was	O
available	O
in	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
thicknesses	O
.	O

's	I-MISC

no	O

.	O

The	O

(	O

Public	B-MISC
-	I-MISC
private	I-MISC

Canada	B-LOC
,	O
(	O

)	O
is	O
a	O

Steam	B-MISC
is	O
a	O

Steam	B-MISC
offers	O
digital	O
rights	O

(	O

)	O
,	O
matchmaking	O
servers	O
,	O

.	O

Steam	B-MISC
provides	O
the	O
user	O

automatic	O
updating	O
of	O
games	O

software	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

560	B-NUM

.	O

.	O

Wichqana	B-LOC

Culture	O
:	O
Wichqana	B-LOC
was	O
active	O

-	O

The	O
four	B-MISC
-	I-MISC
spotted	I-MISC
butterflyfish	I-MISC

fourspot	B-MISC

)	O

Wehrkraftzersetzung	B-MISC
is	O
a	O
term	O
from	O
German	B-LOC
military	O
law	O
during	O
the	O
Third	B-LOC
Reich	I-LOC
.	O

In	O
1938	B-TIME
,	O
with	O
Adolf	B-PER
Hitler	I-PER
moving	O
Germany	B-LOC
closer	O
to	O
war	O
,	O
the	O
Nazi	B-ORG
government	O
issued	O
a	O
decree	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
suppressing	O
any	O
activity	O
opposed	O
to	O
the	O
Nazi	B-ORG
regime	O
or	O
the	O
Wehrmacht	B-ORG
.	O

The	O
anti	O
-	O
sedition	O
decree	O
included	O
the	O
crime	O
of	O
Zersetzung	B-MISC
der	I-MISC
Wehrkraft	I-MISC
.	O

Commonly	O
called	O
Wehrkraftzersetzung	B-MISC
,	O
the	O
term	O
is	O
variously	O
translated	O
as	O
"	O
subversion	O
of	O
the	O
war	O
effort	O
"	O
,	O
"	O
undermining	O
military	O
morale	O
"	O
and	O
"	O
sedition	O
and	O
defeatism	O
"	O
.	O

Paragraphs	O
already	O
in	O
the	O
military	O
penal	O
code	O
were	O
consolidated	O
and	O
redefined	O
,	O
creating	O
the	O
new	O
crime	O
,	O
which	O
carried	O
the	O
death	O
penalty	O
.	O

In	O
1939	B-TIME
,	O
a	O
second	O
decree	O
was	O
issued	O
that	O
extended	O
the	O
crime	O
to	O
civilians	O
.	O

Discouraging	O
statements	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
doubt	O
about	O
the	O
ultimate	O
victory	O
of	O
the	O
Third	B-LOC
Reich	I-LOC
,	O

any	O

of	O
its	O
political	O

leadership	O
and	O

form	O
of	O
government	O

by	O
death	O
,	O
or	O
heavy	O

military	O
prisons	O
,	O
concentration	O
camps	O

deployment	O
to	O
the	O
field	O
or	O
to	O

.	O

Conscientious	O

in	O
particular	O
were	O
frequently	O

of	O
Wehrkraftzersetzung	B-MISC
in	O

to	O
other	O

.	O

This	O

to	O
reduce	O

of	O

on	O
others	O

.	O

Pasquale	B-PER
Cicogna	I-PER
was	O
the	O
Doge	O
of	O
Venice	B-LOC
from	O
1585	B-TIME
to	O
1595	B-TIME
.	O

He	O
supported	O
the	O
claim	O
of	O
Henry	B-PER
of	I-PER
Navarre	I-PER
to	O
the	O
French	B-LOC
throne	O

and	O

Pope	O
Sixtus	B-PER
V	I-PER
to	O
support	O
Henry	B-PER
in	O

.	O

broke	O

were	O

.	O

As	O
his	O
reign	O
of	O
Doge	O
continued	O

because	O
he	O
was	O
very	O

and	O

tackle	O

problems	O
with	O
great	O
success	O
.	O

his	O

was	O
converting	O
the	O
Rialto	B-LOC
Bridge	I-LOC
,	O
one	O
of	O
Venice	B-LOC
's	O
major	O
landmarks	O
and	O
the	O
only	O
bridge	O
over	O
the	O
Grand	B-LOC
Canal	I-LOC
of	O
Venice	B-LOC
,	O
from	O
wood	O
to	O
stone	O
between	O
1588	B-TIME
and	O
1591	B-TIME
.	O

Although	O
greater	O
names	O
such	O
as	O
Michelangelo	B-PER
had	O
submitted	O
designs	O
,	O

CAPICOM	B-MISC
is	O
a	O

control	O

to	O

of	O

Cryptographic	B-MISC
Application	I-MISC
Programming	I-MISC
Interface	I-MISC
(	O
CryptoAPI	B-MISC
)	O

through	O
Microsoft	B-ORG
Component	B-MISC
Object	I-MISC
Model	I-MISC
(	O

)	O
.	O

It	O

that	O
supports	O
ActiveX.	B-MISC

CAPICOM	B-MISC
can	O
be	O
used	O
to	O
digitally	O
sign	O
data	O
,	O
inspect	O
,	O
verify	O
and	O

,	O

.	O

This	O
is	O
a	O

of	O
Supreme	B-ORG
Court	I-ORG
of	O
the	B-LOC
United	I-LOC

cases	O

the	O

of	O
copyright	O
law	O
.	O

In	O
the	B-MISC
United	I-MISC
States	I-MISC
Constitution	I-MISC
,	O
the	O
Copyright	B-MISC
Clause	I-MISC
in	O
Article	O
1	O
,	O
Section	O
8	O
endows	O

to	O

.	O

To	O

'	O

creating	O
their	O
own	O

systems	O
,	O

passed	O

Act	I-MISC
of	I-MISC
1790	I-MISC
,	O
based	O
on	O
Great	B-LOC
Britain	I-LOC
's	O
Statute	B-MISC
of	I-MISC
Anne	I-MISC
.	O

Over	O

,	O

in	O
the	B-LOC

has	O

a	O

system	O
with	O

and	O

has	O

the	O
Court	B-ORG
.	O

The	O
Supreme	B-ORG
Court	I-ORG
was	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
concepts	O
in	O
the	O
field	O
,	O

idea	O
-	O

articles	O
or	O
separability	O

of	O
federal	O

.	O

This	O
list	O
is	O
a	O

solely	O
of	O
United	B-ORG
States	I-ORG

Not	O

and	O
,	O

.	O

opinions	O
.	O

Regional	O
effects	O
of	O
global	O
warming	O
are	O
long	O
-	O
term	O
significant	O
changes	O
in	O
the	O
expected	O
patterns	O
of	O
average	O
weather	O
of	O
a	O
specific	O
region	O
due	O
to	O
global	O
warming	O
.	O

The	O
world	O
average	O
temperature	O
is	O
rising	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
greenhouse	O
effect	O
caused	O
by	O
increasing	O
levels	O
of	O
greenhouse	O
gases	O
,	O
especially	O
carbon	O
dioxide	O
.	O

When	O
the	O
global	O
temperature	O
changes	O
,	O
the	O
changes	O
in	O
climate	O
are	O
not	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
uniform	O
across	O
the	O
Earth	B-LOC
.	O

In	O
particular	O
,	O
land	O
areas	O
change	O
more	O
quickly	O
than	O
oceans	O
,	O
and	O
northern	O
high	O
latitudes	O
change	O
more	O
quickly	O
than	O
the	O
tropics	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
margins	O
of	O
biome	O
regions	O
change	O
faster	O
than	O
do	O
their	O
cores	O
.	O

Regional	O
effects	O
of	O
global	O
warming	O
vary	O
in	O
nature	O
.	O

Some	O
are	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
generalised	O
global	O
change	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
rising	O
temperature	O
,	O
resulting	O
in	O
local	O
effects	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
melting	O
ice	O
.	O

In	O
other	O
cases	O
,	O
a	O
change	O
may	O
be	O
related	O
to	O
a	O
change	O
in	O
a	O
particular	O
ocean	O
current	O
or	O
weather	O
system	O
.	O

In	O
such	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
regional	O
effect	O
may	O
be	O
disproportionate	O
and	O
will	O
not	O
necessarily	O
follow	O
the	O
global	O
trend	O
.	O

The	O
increasing	O
temperatures	O
from	O
greenhouse	O
gases	O
have	O
been	O
causing	O
sea	O
levels	O
to	O
rise	O
for	O
many	O
years	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
three	B-NUM
major	O
ways	O
in	O
which	O
global	O
warming	O
will	O
make	O
changes	O
to	O
regional	O
climate	O
:	O
melting	O
or	O
forming	O
ice	O
,	O
changing	O
the	O
hydrological	O
cycle	O
(	O
of	O
evaporation	O
and	O
precipitation	O
)	O
and	O
changing	O
currents	O
in	O
the	O
oceans	O
and	O
air	O
flows	O
in	O
the	O
atmosphere	O
.	O

The	O
coast	O
can	O
also	O
be	O
considered	O
a	O
region	O
,	O
and	O
will	O
suffer	O
severe	O
impacts	O
from	O
sea	O
level	O
rise	O
.	O

The	O
Arctic	B-LOC
,	O
Africa	B-LOC
,	O
small	O
islands	O
and	O
Asian	B-LOC
megadeltas	O
are	O
regions	O
that	O
are	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
especially	O
affected	O
by	O
future	O
climate	O
change	O
.	O

Africa	B-LOC
is	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
most	O
vulnerable	O
continents	O
to	O
climate	O
variability	O
and	O
change	O
because	O
of	O
multiple	O
existing	O
stresses	O
and	O
low	O
adaptive	O
capacity	O
.	O

Climate	O
change	O
is	O
projected	O
to	O
decrease	O
freshwater	O
availability	O
in	O
central	O
,	O
south	O
,	O
east	O
and	O
southeast	O
Asia	B-LOC
,	O
particularly	O
in	O
large	O
river	O
basins	O
.	O

With	O
population	O
growth	O
and	O
increasing	O
demand	O
from	O
higher	O
standards	O
of	O
living	O
,	O
this	O
decrease	O
could	O
adversely	O
affect	O
more	O
than	O
a	B-NUM
billion	I-NUM
people	O
by	O
the	O
2050s	B-TIME
.	O

Small	O
islands	O
,	O
whether	O
located	O
in	O
the	O
tropics	O
or	O
higher	O
latitudes	O
,	O
are	O
already	O
exposed	O
to	O
extreme	O
weather	O
events	O
and	O
changes	O
in	O
sea	O
level	O
.	O

This	O
existing	O
exposure	O
will	O
likely	O
make	O
these	O
areas	O
sensitive	O
to	O
the	O
effects	O
of	O
climate	O
change	O
.	O

A	O
geologic	O
era	O
is	O
a	O
subdivision	O
of	O
geologic	O
time	O
that	O
divides	O
an	O
eon	O
into	O
smaller	O
units	O
of	O
time	O
.	O

The	O
Phanerozoic	B-TIME
Eon	I-TIME
is	O
divided	O
into	O
three	B-NUM
such	O
time	O
frames	O
:	O
the	O
Paleozoic	B-TIME
,	O
Mesozoic	B-TIME
,	O
and	O
Cenozoic	B-TIME
(	O
meaning	O
"	O
old	O
life	O
"	O
,	O
"	O
middle	O
life	O
"	O
and	O
"	O
recent	O
life	O
"	O
)	O
that	O
represent	O
the	O
major	O
stages	O
in	O
the	O
macroscopic	O
fossil	O
record	O
.	O

These	O
eras	O
are	O
separated	O
by	O
catastrophic	O
extinction	O
boundaries	O
,	O
the	O
P	B-MISC
-	I-MISC
T	I-MISC
boundary	I-MISC
between	O
the	O
Paleozoic	B-TIME
and	O
the	O
Mesozoic	B-TIME
and	O
the	O
K	B-MISC
-	I-MISC
Pg	I-MISC
boundary	I-MISC
between	O
the	O
Mesozoic	B-TIME
and	O
the	O
Cenozoic	B-TIME
.	O

There	O
is	O
evidence	O
that	O
catastrophic	O
meteorite	O
impacts	O
played	O
a	O
role	O
in	O
demarcating	O
the	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
eras	O
.	O

The	O
Hadean	B-TIME
,	O
Archean	B-TIME
and	O
Proterozoic	B-TIME
eons	O
were	O
as	O
a	O
whole	O
formerly	O
called	O
the	O
Precambrian	B-TIME
.	O

This	O
covered	O
the	O
four	B-NUM
billion	I-NUM
years	O
of	O
Earth	B-LOC
history	O
prior	O
to	O
the	O
appearance	O
of	O
hard	O
-	O
shelled	O
animals	O
.	O

More	O
recently	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
the	O
Archean	B-TIME
and	O
Proterozoic	B-TIME
eons	O
have	O
been	O
subdivided	O
into	O
eras	O
of	O
their	O
own	O
.	O

Geologic	O
eras	O
are	O
further	O
subdivided	O
into	O
geologic	O
periods	O
,	O
although	O
the	O
Archean	B-TIME
eras	O
have	O
yet	O
to	O
be	O
subdivided	O
in	O
this	O
way	O
.	O

OpenVMS	B-MISC
is	O
a	O
closed	O
-	O
source	O
,	O

system	O
for	O
use	O
in	O

-	O

.	O

is	O
the	O
successor	O
to	O
the	O
VMS	B-MISC
Operating	I-MISC
System	I-MISC
(	O
VAX-11/VMS	B-MISC
,	O
VAX	B-MISC
/	I-MISC

)	O
,	O
that	O
was	O
produced	O
by	O
Digital	B-ORG
Equipment	I-ORG
Corporation	I-ORG
,	O
and	O
first	O
released	O
in	O
1977	B-TIME
for	O
its	O

.	O

The	O
11/780	O
was	O

at	O
DEC	B-ORG
's	O
Oct.	B-TIME
25	I-TIME
,	I-TIME

.	O

In	O

,	O

was	O
used	O
for	O
the	O
successor	O
series	O
of	O
DEC	B-MISC
Alpha	I-MISC
systems	O
.	O

also	O
runs	O
on	O
the	O
HP	B-MISC

-	O
based	O
families	O
of	O

to	O

-	I-MISC

.	O

The	O

is	O

from	O
virtual	O
memory	O
system	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
one	O
of	O

is	O
a	O

system	O
,	O
but	O
source	O
code	O
listings	O
are	O
available	O
for	O

OpenVMS	B-MISC
is	O
a	O
multi	O
-	O
user	O
,	O
multiprocessing	O
virtual	O
memory	O
-	O
based	O

system	O
(	O
OS	B-MISC
)	O

for	O
use	O
in	O
time	O
-	O
sharing	O
,	O
batch	O
processing	O
,	O
and	O
transaction	O
processing	O
.	O

When	O
process	O

are	O
suitably	O
adjusted	O

it	O
may	O
approach	O
real	O
-	O
time	O
operating	O
system	O

.	O

The	O

offers	O
high	O
availability	O
through	O
clustering	O
and	O
the	O

to	O

over	O
multiple	O

.	O

This	O

to	O

against	O
disasters	O
that	O
may	O
disable	O
individual	O
data	O
-	O
processing	O
facilities	O
.	O

OpenVMS	B-MISC
contains	O

The	O

the	O

.	O

The	O

China	B-LOC
as	O

as	O

12th	I-TIME
century	I-TIME

was	O

Swabia	B-LOC
(;	O
,	O
colloquially	O
Schwabenland	B-LOC
or	O
Ländle	B-LOC
;	O

English	B-MISC
also	O
archaic	O
Suabia	B-LOC
or	O
Svebia	B-LOC
)	O
is	O

in	O

of	I-LOC

,	O

.	O

area	O

of	O

century	I-TIME
.	O

Eaton	B-MISC
's	I-MISC
Corrasable	I-MISC
Bond	I-MISC
is	O
a	O
trademarked	O
name	O
for	O
a	O
brand	O
of	O
erasable	O
typing	O
paper	O
.	O

Erasable	O
paper	O
has	O
a	O
glazed	O
or	O
coated	O
surface	O
which	O
is	O
almost	O
invisible	O
,	O
is	O
easily	O
removed	O
by	O
friction	O
,	O
and	O
accepts	O
typewriter	O
ink	O
fairly	O
well	O
.	O

Removing	O
the	O
coating	O
removes	O
the	O
ink	O
on	O
top	O
of	O
it	O
,	O
so	O
mistakes	O
can	O
be	O
easily	O
erased	O
once	O
.	O

After	O
erasure	O
,	O
the	O
correction	O
is	O
typed	O
onto	O
an	O
unprotected	O
paper	O
surface	O
and	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
easily	O
erased	O
a	O
second	O
time	O
.	O

Because	O
the	O
coated	O
surface	O
does	O
not	O
absorb	O
ink	O
,	O
erasable	O
paper	O
is	O
apt	O
to	O
smudge	O
.	O

Since	O
the	O
coating	O
is	O
intended	O
to	O
be	O
easily	O
removed	O
by	O
friction	O

the	O
typed	O
pages	O
are	O
not	O
very	O
durable	O
.	O

some	O
storage	O

the	O

is	O
apt	O
to	O
make	O
pages	O
stick	O
together	O
.	O

paper	O

not	O

for	O

documents	O

archival	O
records	O
.	O

It	O

in	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
thicknesses	O
.	O

Gladstonian	B-MISC
liberalism	I-MISC
is	O
a	O
political	O
doctrine	O
named	O
after	O
the	O
British	B-LOC
Victorian	B-TIME
Prime	O
Minister	O
and	O
leader	O
of	O
the	O
Liberal	B-ORG
Party	I-ORG
,	O
William	B-PER
Ewart	I-PER
Gladstone	I-PER
.	O

Gladstonian	B-MISC
liberalism	I-MISC
consisted	O
of	O
limited	O
government	O
expenditure	O
and	O
low	O
taxation	O
whilst	O
making	O
sure	O
government	O
had	O
balanced	O
budgets	O
and	O
the	O
classical	O
liberal	O
stress	O
on	O
self	O
-	O
help	O
and	O
freedom	O
of	O
choice	O
.	O

Gladstonian	B-MISC
liberalism	I-MISC
also	O
emphasised	O
free	O
trade	O
,	O
little	O
government	O
intervention	O
in	O
the	O
economy	O
and	O
equality	O
of	O
opportunity	O
through	O
institutional	O
reform	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
laissez	O
-	O
faire	O
or	O
classical	O
liberalism	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-LOC
Kingdom	I-LOC
and	O
is	O
often	O
compared	O
to	O
Thatcherism	B-MISC
.	O

Gladstonian	B-MISC
financial	O
rectitude	O
had	O
a	O
partial	O
lasting	O
impact	O
on	O
British	B-LOC
politics	O
and	O
the	O
historian	O
John	B-PER
Vincent	I-PER
contends	O
that	O
under	O
Lord	O
Salisbury	B-PER
's	O
premiership	O
he	O
"	O
left	O
Britain	B-LOC

low	O
tax	O
,	O
low	O
cost	O
,	O
low	O
growth	O
economy	O
,	O
with	O
its	O
Gladstonian	B-MISC
finance	O
and	O
its	O
free	O
trade	O
dogmas	O
,	O
and	O
no	O
conscript	O
army	O
,	O

as	O
he	O
had	O

it	O
...	O
Salisbury	B-PER
reigned	O
,	O
but	O

ruled	O
"	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
early	O
20th	B-TIME
-	I-TIME
century	I-TIME

Liberal	B-ORG
Party	I-ORG

to	O

Gladstonian	B-MISC

(	O

"	O

"	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Liberal	B-ORG
government	O
of	O
1906	B-TIME
–	O
1914	B-TIME
is	O
noted	O
for	O
its	O
social	O

and	O

old	O

and	O
National	B-MISC

.	O

was	O
also	O

and	O
New	B-ORG
Liberal	I-ORG
ideas	O
led	O
to	O
David	B-PER
Lloyd	I-PER
George	I-PER
's	O
People	B-MISC
's	I-MISC
Budget	I-MISC
of	O
1909–1910	B-TIME
.	O

first	O

of	O
the	O

,	O
Philip	B-PER

,	O

The	B-MISC
Rebellion	B-MISC
Losses	I-MISC
Bill	I-MISC
(	O
full	O
name	O
:	O
An	B-MISC

to	I-MISC
provide	I-MISC
for	I-MISC

of	I-MISC

in	I-MISC
Lower	I-MISC
Canada	I-MISC
whose	I-MISC

was	I-MISC
destroyed	I-MISC
during	I-MISC

Rebellion	I-MISC
in	I-MISC

years	I-MISC

and	I-MISC

was	O

of	O
the	O
Province	B-LOC
of	I-LOC

.	O

Its	O

and	O

by	O
the	O
Governor	O
General	O
,	O
James	B-PER
Bruce	I-PER
,	O

Earl	O
of	O
Elgin	O
makes	O

bill	O

of	O

Canadian	B-LOC
political	O
history	O
.	O

The	O
bill	O
was	O
enacted	O
to	O
compensate	O
Lower	B-ORG
Canadians	I-ORG
who	O
lost	O
property	O
during	O
the	O
Rebellions	B-MISC
of	I-MISC
1837	I-MISC
with	O
measures	O
similar	O
to	O
those	O
providing	O
compensation	O
in	O
Upper	B-LOC
Canada	I-LOC
.	O

Two	B-NUM
factors	O
made	O
this	O
measure	O
controversial	O
.	O

Even	O
though	O
participants	O
in	O
the	O
Rebellion	B-MISC
could	O
not	O

with	O
taxpayer	O

for	O
the	O
Rebellion	B-MISC
were	O
more	O
widespread	O
in	O
Lower	B-ORG
Canada	I-ORG
so	O
that	O
compensation	O
in	O
Lower	B-ORG
Canada	I-ORG
was	O
seen	O
as	O
"	O
giving	O
money	O
to	O
the	O
rebels	O
"	O
.	O

Secondly	O
,	O

damage	O
done	O
by	O
the	O
army	O
far	O
exceed	O
the	O
damage	O

by	O
the	O

that	O

to	O

for	O
damages	O
done	O
by	O
the	O
army	O
was	O

to	O
the	O
Crown	B-ORG
.	O

The	O

The	O
zhuihu	O
(	O
坠胡	O
,	O
pinyin	O
:	O
zhùihú	O
;	O
also	O
called	O
zhuiqin	O
or	O
zhuizixian	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
two	B-NUM
-	I-NUM
stringed	I-NUM
bowed	O
string	O
instrument	O
from	O
China	B-LOC
.	O

In	O
construction	O
,	O
it	O
resembles	O
the	O
sanxian	O
,	O
and	O
likely	O
evolved	O
as	O
a	O
bowed	O
version	O
of	O
that	O
musical	O
instrument	O
.	O

Unlike	O
bowed	O
string	O
instruments	O
in	O
the	O
huqin	O
family	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
the	O
erhu	O
)	O
,	O
the	O
zhuihu	O
has	O
a	O
fretless	O
fingerboard	O
against	O
which	O
the	O
strings	O
are	O
pressed	O
while	O
playing	O
.	O

The	O
zhuihu	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
accompany	O
a	O
form	O
of	O
traditional	O
narrative	O
singing	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
zhuizi	O
,	O
which	O
originated	O
in	O
the	O
Henan	B-LOC
province	O
of	O
China	B-LOC
.	O

A	O
more	O
modern	O
version	O
of	O
the	O
zhuihu	O
called	O
the	O
leiqin	O
was	O
developed	O
in	O
China	B-LOC
in	O
the	O
20th	B-TIME
century	I-TIME
.	O

Another	O
related	O
instrument	O
is	O
the	O
Japanese	B-LOC
kokyū	O
.	O

.	O

Canada	B-LOC
,	O
(	O

(	O

)	O
,	O
company	B-MISC
-	I-MISC

,	O

.	O

when	O
the	O

language	O

was	O

heavy	O
use	O

DCL	B-MISC
is	O
a	O

language	O

arrays	O

,	O
but	O
not	O

Cane	B-MISC
is	O
a	O

.	O

The	O

is	O

as	O
a	O

of	O

around	O
the	O

in	O

United	I-LOC

.	O

of	O
the	O
